results.title: Beta-blocker therapy failures in symptomatic probands with genotyped long-QT syndrome.
results.text_hl: The study cohort comprised 28 such @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@: 18 @GENE_KCNQ1 @GENE_3784 @@@KCNQ1@@@/@GENE_KCNQ1 @GENE_3784 @@@KVLQT1@@@(@GENE_KCNQ1 @GENE_3784 @@@LQT1@@@), 7 @GENE_KCNH2 @GENE_3757 @@@KCNH2@@@/@GENE_KCNH2 @GENE_3757 @@@HERG@@@ (@DISEASE_Romano_Ward_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D029597 @@@LQT2@@@), and 3 @GENE_SCN5A @GENE_6331 @@@SCN5A@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Long_QT_syndrome_type_3</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537034 @@@LQT3@@@). The prescribed beta-blocker was @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (12), @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (10), @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (4), and @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@ (2).

citations.NLM: Chatrath R, Bell CM, Ackerman MJ. Beta-blocker therapy failures in symptomatic probands with genotyped long-QT syndrome. Pediatr Cardiol. 2004 Sep-Oct;25(5):459-65. PMID: 15534720
